comment: Great teacher If I was still a business major I would minor just to take his classes makes Class interesting gfy if you don't agree

I would recommend this class/professor. The class was really interesting. All of the tests are open book/ open note, so they were really easy. Attendance is mandatory, but you pretty much can just sign in and leave.
Great professor. Lots of examples. You have to read. Open notes for the test but still difficult. Learned ALOT. Take him if he doesn't retire. Just study and you will get the grade that you deserve.

He does mumble, but his stories help with the application of material on test questions. So going to class and listening is important! The book is helpful if you actually read it.  Yes, tests are a bit hard but it's college people. Tests are open book, open note, open laptop, and he does curve tests. Made an A in the class.

Awesome professor! Test are difficult so study the material multiple times before the test, even though open book/note/laptop. Hard to focus, helps if you sit close and actively engage by taking notes. He is very nice, and tries to make it as interesting as possible. You will learn alot. Best if you sit in front. Don't sleep.
Even though tests are open book/note/computer, they are extremely hard. So hard to come to class because it is so boring and he mumbles. Take someone else if possible.

AVOID HIM. I did decently and I still say don't take him. He's wicked incomprehensible and boring. Tests are open note/book/laptop but are still extremely difficult because they're situational and require obscure application of principles. Paper's an easy A, but test averages were always below a 75 and he doesn't often curve. 1-time bonus for 15pts

Honestly, Business law is not the most interesting class, but Professor Harbour tried his best to make class interesting. Open book tests, one paper, and he covers everything in his online notes. I got a 98 in the class, I would highly recommend

It took me a couple weeks for my ears to adjust to his speech- no joke. Mumbles and trails off a lot and jumps around but you sort of get used to it. Otherwise, extremely fair on tests and just an overall chillaxed class.

Prof. Harbour is an excellent professor that does a great job using real world examples to teach. He's an attorney, so he has a lot of hands-on experience to share and that helps alot with the subject matter. Tests are open note and open book, but you have to read the chapters and attend class to know what is going on. He makes it as easy as he can

didnt like the class. takes attendance every class. tests are open note open book. but the questions are more of an example and tell me what the example means. have to write one paper. hard to stay focused in the class. he jumbles his words together sometimes & talks fast.

Professor Harbour is an overall good professor. I would recommended him especially if you are interested in law. His lectures can be boring at times, but he interacts with his students and uses real life examples. Easy A!
